page.title: 15Interview: a local resident
page.content: Mrs.Raine lived in Evenwood, but she moved to Ingleton after a bomb dropped on her doorstep in{1916}. She lived at no.1 Church View, then moved to Smithson House opposite. Mrs. Raine enjoys living in Ingleton and thought there were no drawbacks. As a child Mrs.Raine went to the old{Ingleton School}, it was the first school in County Durham to have a wireless. They later bought a gramophone which was later stolen, but fortunately it was found down Green Lane. When{John Wesley}was preaching in Barnard Castle the people began to stone him.He was taken for safety to a forefather of Mrs. R. Raine and given a meal, and Mrs.Raine is the proud possessor of the dinner plate from which he ate his meal.{By M.Burton
